name: JFrogAudit
description: Audit your local project's dependencies by generating a dependency tree and scanning it with Xray.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: xrayConnection
inputs.label: JFrog Xray service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: JFrog Xray service to be used by this task. (This functionality requires version 3.29.0 or above of JFrog Xray)

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory where the command will run. When empty, the value of '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)' is used.

inputs.name: watchesSource
inputs.label: Xray Watches Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the source to obtain Xray watches, to determine Xray's violations creation.

inputs.name: watches
inputs.label: Xray watches list
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma separated list of Xray watches, to determine Xray's violations creation.

inputs.name: repoPath
inputs.label: Artifactory Repository Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target repo path, to enable Xray to determine watches accordingly.

inputs.name: licenses
inputs.label: Show licenses
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you'd also like to show licenses information for the project dependencies.

inputs.name: allowFailBuild
inputs.label: Allow fail build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Unset if you don't wish the audit process to exit with code 3, if a violation matching an Xray policy is found, and the policy includes a 'Fail Build' rule.
